result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher P Lovelace was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install [Modifiers: Extend Order for Ignition Interlock Device], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 347.413(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher P Lovelace

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: from Clerk to Defendant re: payment arrangements
No Appearance by Defendant.  Defendant has made payment arrangements.  Court orders Warrant - stay pending compliance with Payment Plan Agreement.
Original Warrant has been received and destroyed.  tw
Warrant was canceled.  Talked to Christina at GLSO.  tw
from Clerk to Defendant re: Warrant
No Appearance by Defendant.  Court orders Warrant.

1:59 p.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his right to an attorney.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to count 2 and counts 1 & 3 will be dismissed and read-in.  DA concurs.  Defendant concurs.  Court goes over right to counsel.  Defendant waives right to counsel.  Court accepts waiver.

Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty to count 2 as charged.  Court orders counts 1 & 3 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to: $150.00 fine plus costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.  IID is extended for 6 months.  Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court adjourned at 2:06 p.m.

Defendant called, he just got the notice of hearing and does not have a drivers license.  Matter adjourned to July 27, 2015 at 1:30 p.m.  Address on file is correct.
43

9:21 a.m.  No Appearance by the defendant.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court orders a warrant - stayed for ten days.

Court adjourned at 9:21 a.m.
